body:
You can list the versions of a file here

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/api/driveitem_list_versions?view=odsp-graph-online

I couldn't find a way of deleting previous versions though - can anyone see one?

I suspect to delete versions then you'd have to do a rename or a copy (something which gets rid of the versions) then rename it back. How does that .NET code do it? Can you see?

Take a look here: https://github.com/balassy/OneDriveVersionCleaner/blob/master/OneDriveVersionCleaner/Program.cs#L124

I am not sure if this is the documentation for the same API, but here is more clarificaion on the method in question: 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/office/sharepoint-server/ee538326(v=office.15)

> I am not sure if this is the documentation for the same API, but here is more clarificaion on the method in question:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/office/sharepoint-server/ee538326(v=office.15)

The C# API cannot be used in rclone.

I performed a few tests and discovered that it is possible to delete versions from Onedrive Business. After obtaining a [ListItemVersion](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/listitemversion?view=graph-rest-1.0), you can send a ```DELETE /v1.0/sites/{site-id}/items/{item-id}/versions/{version-id}```, which will complete with a 200 OK. The old version is then also immediately gone when verifying using the web UI.

Trying the same on a [DriveItemVersion](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/resources/driveitemversion?view=odsp-graph-online) does lead to a 400 Bad Request though.

If we can delete versions, then we could theoretically delete them in rclone. The `rclone cleaup` command is for that sort of thing.

Alternatively we could delete the extra version in the `SetModTime` calls which is where they come from.

issue.title: rclone generate versions when using chunker on onedrive wasting 50% available space

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Using current version of rclone (1.40-1.50) I noticed that all my onedrive 5TB were full after filling with 2.5TB (with copy/sync) ONLY if using the chunker to split large files. 
After a lot of googling and frustation I found evidences that each chunk file was being saved twice as version history.

This might be affecting other storage types, but I'm not sure. For sure this is an issue on Onedrive.

body:
> I wrote simple script which uses rclone, curl and jq to clean up all old versions: [onedrive-cleanup.sh](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/4838990/onedrive-cleanup.txt)

You are a saint my dear. The script works like magic and the best part is OneDrive deletes it permanently (skipping trash).
There was a typo on line 6 though. I hope someone would be kind enough to implement this on Rclone.
@Cnly I don't know if you've see https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4373 yet but using onedrive with chunker seems to be creating versions

@ncw But if multiple versions are created by just uploading files (no existing ones overwritten) to a non-nested onedrive backend through `rclone copy`, it doesn't seem to be the same case as #4373...

Anyway, perhaps we should follow all metadata-changing operations with a version cleanup.

> Anyway, perhaps we should follow all metadata-changing operations with a version cleanup.

Implementing `rclone cleanup` will go a long way towards making happier users! Cleaning up versions for setmodtime would great too.
Slightly altered version of @Saoneth 's script to refresh the access token on every folder if you're cleaning up a really large drive + more verbosity: https://pastebin.com/Vh0qnzFk
